description: A sales trainer uploads a role‑play video, the system transcribes it, extracts persuasion techniques, creates pause‑and‑respond prompts, generates assessment questions, builds an interactive‑video SCORM package, validates it, and returns a download link.

messages.content: You are the EduScormBuilder assistant. Help educators and trainers turn raw learning assets (PDFs, videos, transcripts, question banks) into SCORM‑compatible interactive modules. Use the provided tools to upload files, extract text, transcribe video, identify key concepts, generate assessments, fetch templates, populate modules, validate packages, and store the final SCORM zip. Keep explanations clear, confirm each step with the user, and provide the final download URL when ready.

Hi! I have a 5‑minute MP4 video of a sales pitch role‑play that I want to turn into an interactive SCORM module. I'd like the module to pause at key moments and ask the learner to identify the persuasion technique being used, then give feedback. Can you handle that?

Absolutely! Please upload the video file (MP4) and I’ll get started by storing it in our system.

_Once the upload is complete I will transcribe the video, pull out the main persuasion techniques, generate pause‑and‑respond prompts and an assessment, and then build the SCORM package for you._
Got it – the video is stored as **file_9f7e2d**. I’ll now transcribe it to text so we can analyse the dialogue.

arguments.text: Good morning, thank you for meeting with me today. Let me start by asking a question that gets straight to your biggest challenge... Did you know that 70% of companies in your sector are missing out on revenue because they don’t optimize their supply chain? Our solution reduces waste by 25% and improves delivery times by 15% – that’s a direct impact on your bottom line. I understand you might be skeptical – many have been before you. Let me show you a quick case study...

messages.content: {"concepts": ["Opening hook – asking a probing question", "Statistical evidence – using data to create urgency", "Value proposition – quantifying benefit", "Objection handling – acknowledging skepticism", "Case study illustration – social proof", "Call‑to‑action – prompting next step"]}

Here are the key techniques I extracted:
1. Opening hook – probing question
2. Statistical evidence – urgency
3. Value proposition – quantified benefit
4. Objection handling – acknowledging skepticism
5. Case study illustration – social proof
6. Call‑to‑action – prompting next step

Next, I’ll generate a set of SCORM‑compatible quiz items that will be shown when the video pauses at each of those moments.

{"assessment": [{"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "What persuasion technique is used when the presenter asks a question about the learner's biggest challenge?", "options": ["Opening hook", "Statistical evidence", "Value proposition", "Call‑to‑action"], "answer": "Opening hook"}, {"type": "true_false", "question": "The presenter uses a statistic to create urgency.", "answer": true}, {"type": "short_answer", "question": "State the main benefit presented in the value proposition.", "answer": "Reduces waste by 25% and improves delivery times by 15%"}, {"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "Which technique addresses the learner’s possible skepticism?", "options": ["Objection handling", "Opening hook", "Case study illustration", "Statistical evidence"], "answer": "Objection handling"}, {"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "What type of proof is offered after handling objections?", "options": ["Case study", "Testimonial", "Demo video", "White paper"], "answer": "Case study"}, {"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "What is the final step the presenter asks the learner to do?", "options": ["Schedule a demo", "Sign a contract", "Visit the website", "Provide feedback"], "answer": "Schedule a demo"} ]}
Assessment items are ready. I’ll now fetch an interactive‑video SCORM template that supports pause‑and‑respond points.

Template retrieved. I’ll now compose the slide definitions – each slide corresponds to a key moment in the video, includes a short explanation, and references the video file for the pause point. Then I’ll embed the assessment JSON we generated.

_This may take a moment…_

slides.title: Opening Hook
slides.html_body: Notice how the presenter starts with a probing question. Pause and identify the technique.

slides.title: Statistical Evidence
slides.html_body: Here the presenter cites a 70% statistic to create urgency. Pause and label the technique.

slides.title: Value Proposition
slides.html_body: The benefit is quantified (‑25% waste, +15% delivery). Pause and name the technique.

slides.title: Objection Handling
slides.html_body: The presenter acknowledges possible skepticism. Pause and identify the technique.

slides.title: Case Study Illustration
slides.html_body: A quick case study is shown as social proof. Pause and name the technique.

slides.title: Call‑to‑Action
slides.html_body: Finally, the presenter asks the learner to schedule a demo. Pause and select the technique.

items.answer: Reduces waste by 25% and improves delivery times by 15%

All set! 🎉

You can download your interactive SCORM module here:
**https://cdn.eduscormbuilder.com/modules/sales_pitch_roleplay_training.zip**

The module includes:
- Video with six pause‑and‑respond checkpoints highlighting key persuasion techniques.
- Immediate feedback for each checkpoint.
- A 6‑question assessment that reinforces learning objectives.
- Full SCORM 2004 compliance, ready to upload to any LMS (Moodle, Blackboard, Canvas, etc.).

Let me know if you need any tweaks or want to create another module!
